actions.text: QUESTION OF PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE - Mr. Hamilton rose to a question of the privileges of the House and submitted a resolution for immediate consideration.
DEBATE - After the Chair ruled that the resolution constituted a question of the privileges of the House, Mr. Hamilton was recognized for one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Relating to non-current records of the former Select Committee to Investigate Covert Arms Transactions with Iran, 100th Congress.

summary.text: Requires that the testimonial and documentary evidence in connection with the June 17, 1987, deposition of former Secretary of Defense Caspar W. Weinberger before the Select Committee to Investigate Covert Arms Transactions with Iran, as outlined in the request of June 1, 1992, by the Independent Counsel, be furnished at the direction of the Clerk of the House to the Independent Counsel.

titles.title: Relating to non-current records of the former Select Committee to Investigate Covert Arms Transactions with Iran, 100th Congress.
